title: Imagine Dragons Helps Rebuild Teen’s Home Destroyed by Russia’s War in Ukraine
text: [Texas Teen Says He Shot 2 Friends in the Head Because He Always Wanted to Kill: Police](/news/texas-teen-says-he-shot-2-friends-in-the-head-because-he-always-wanted-to-kill-police?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=trending_story) Imagine Dragons Helps Rebuild Teen’s Home Destroyed by Russia’s War in Ukraine After spotlighting a young Ukrainian boy's story in the music video for 'Crushed,' Dan Reynolds and his band shared a heartwarming update [Mike Vulpo](/author/mike-vulpo) Music from Imagine Dragons is proving to be healing and helpful in a unique way. Nearly seven months after the band released the music video for " [Crushed](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KSav7HayxtI)," one of the project's leading stars is receiving a brand-new home. "One year ago, our friend @ty__arnold met a 14-year-old boy named Sashko in Ukraine," Imagine Dragons and UNITED24 said in a joint [Instagram post](https://www.instagram.com/p/C1aQjz2NFiE/) on Thursday. "He was wandering the streets of his destroyed town of Novohryhorivka, still in disbelief of the complete destruction of his home, his neighborhood and his school." "@ty__arnold captured Sashko's story in our music video for 'Crushed,'" the statement explained. "Thanks to UNITED24 (which we support) and their donor @avrora.multimarket, Sashko and his mother's house has been rebuilt." Following six months of construction, Sashko was able to receive the keys to his new house. He also received a special message from the members of Imagine Dragons. "We are so incredibly proud of you," lead singer [Dan Reynolds](https://themessenger.com/entertainment/dan-reynolds-loveloud-imagine-dragons-lgbtq-issues-exclusive) told Sashko when he was able to open the doors. "You have inspired us. You've inspired thousands of people across the globe. Thank you to all the incredible donors who made this happen. And above all, Sashko, welcome home."
